</p><p>31 марта 2014&#160;года министр финансов ФРГ <a href="/wiki/%D0%92%D0%BE%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%84%D0%B3%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B3_%D0%A8%D0%BE%D0%B9%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%B5" class="mw-redirect" title="Вольфганг Шойбле">Вольфганг Шойбле</a> публично сравнил действия России в Крыму и действия Гитлера по захвату Судет<sup id="cite&#95;ref-Hitlers&#95;Politik&#95;411-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hitlers_Politik-411"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>402<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite&#95;ref-412" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-412"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>403<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>. Москва в ответ заявила протест, а канцлер Германии <a href="/wiki/%D0%90%D0%BD%D0%B3%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B0_%D0%9C%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%BA%D0%B5%D0%BB%D1%8C" class="mw-redirect" title="Ангела Меркель">Ангела Меркель</a> и министр иностранных дел Германии <a href="/wiki/%D0%A4%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%BA-%D0%92%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%80_%D0%A8%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%B9%D0%BD%D0%BC%D0%B0%D0%B9%D0%B5%D1%80" class="mw-redirect" title="Франк-Вальтер Штайнмайер">Франк-Вальтер Штайнмайер</a> дистанцировались от такой аналогии<sup id="cite&#95;ref-413" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-413"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>404<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>. В то же время замглавы партии <a href="/wiki/%D0%A5%D0%94%D0%A1_%D0%93%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%BC%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B8" class="mw-redirect" title="ХДС Германии">ХДС</a> <a href="/wiki/%D0%A4%D0%BE%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B5%D1%80_%D0%91%D1%83%D1%84%D1%8C%D0%B5" class="mw-redirect" title="Фолькер Буфье">Фолькер Буфье</a> заявил: «Аннексия Крыма сравнима с аннексией Судет при Гитлере», указав «что в обоих случаях события развивались по аналогичному шаблону»<sup id="cite&#95;ref-414" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-414"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>405<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>. Весной 2014&#160;года параллель между Путиным и Гитлером также проводили бывший госсекретарь США <a href="/wiki/%D0%A5%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B8_%D0%9A%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%BD" class="mw-redirect" title="Хиллари Клинтон">Хиллари Клинтон</a> и британский <a href="/wiki/%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%86_%D0%A7%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%B7" class="mw-redirect" title="Принц Чарльз">принц Чарльз</a><sup id="cite&#95;ref-415" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-415"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>406<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>.
</p><p>Действия <a href="/wiki/%D0%97%D0%B0%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BC%D0%B8%D1%80" title="Западный мир">западных государств</a> в ответ на аннексию Крыма в 2014&#160;году также сравнивали с <a href="/wiki/%D0%9F%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B0_%D1%83%D0%BC%D0%B8%D1%80%D0%BE%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8F" title="Политика умиротворения">политикой умиротворения</a> <a href="/wiki/%D0%93%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%80,_%D0%90%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%84" title="Гитлер, Адольф">Адольфа Гитлера</a> и <a href="/wiki/%D0%9C%D1%8E%D0%BD%D1%85%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B5_%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%B3%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%88%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B5" title="Мюнхенское соглашение">Мюнхенским соглашением</a> в 1930-х<sup id="cite&#95;ref-416" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-416"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>407<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite&#95;ref-Crimean&#95;Anschluss&#95;417-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Crimean_Anschluss-417"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>408<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite&#95;ref-lessons&#95;of&#95;history&#95;418-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lessons_of_history-418"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>409<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Примечания"><span id=".D0.9F.D1.80.D0.B8.D0.BC.D0.B5.D1.87.D0.B0.D0.BD.D0.B8.D1.8F"></span>Примечания</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Комментарии"><span id=".D0.9A.D0.BE.D0.BC.D0.BC.D0.B5.D0.BD.D1.82.D0.B0.D1.80.D0.B8.D0.B8"></span>Комментарии</h3></div>
<div class="reflist columns reflist-wide" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references" data-mw-group="lower-alpha">
<li id="cite&#95;note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-11">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">Россией признано постфактум, а во время событий отрицалось<sup id="cite&#95;ref-их&#95;там&#95;нет&#95;10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-их_там_нет-10"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-66">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">голосование Верховной рады об отмене <a href="/wiki/%D0%97%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BD_%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%8B_%C2%AB%D0%9E%D0%B1_%D0%BE%D1%81%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D1%85_%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%83%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B9_%D1%8F%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BE%D0%B9_%D0%BF%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8%C2%BB" class="mw-redirect" title="Закон Украины «Об основах государственной языковой политики»">закона об основах государственной языковой политики</a>, подготовка закона о <a href="/wiki/%D0%9B%D1%8E%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%8F_%D0%BD%D0%B0_%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B5" title="Люстрация на Украине">люстрации</a>, радикальные заявления активистов Евромайдана и политических деятелей</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-199"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-199">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">В отчёте Миссии ОБСЕ по оценке положения в области прав человека, работавшей на Украине в марте-апреле 2014 года, отмечалось, что выяснить принадлежность и подчинённость действовавших в Крыму вооружённых групп и отрядов не представлялось возможным: их участники носили разную форму и представлялись членами отрядов «самообороны», «Армии Крыма», казаками или членами других организаций. Действуя вне рамок правового поля, эти группы пользовались попустительством, а иногда и активным соучастием властей, де-факто контролировавших территорию Крыма, включая правоохранительные органы<sup id="cite&#95;ref-&#95;89f9f2102e90490c&#95;198-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-_89f9f2102e90490c-198"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>196<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-205"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-205">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">в различных вариантах: перейти на сторону России, сложить оружие, или покинуть Крым<sup id="cite&#95;ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>201<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-264"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-264">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">Нередко называется «непризнанным государством», однако такое определение проблематично в отношении политий, получивших определённое (хотя и ограниченное) признание, см. <a href="/wiki/%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B5_%D0%B8_%D1%87%D0%B0%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%BE_%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B5_%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%83%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B0#ЧПГ" title="Непризнанные и частично признанные государства">подробнее</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-281"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-281">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">Впрочем, <a href="/wiki/%D0%9B%D0%B5%D0%B3%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%8C" title="Легитимность">легитимность</a> референдума рядом авторов допускается, см. напр. Rein Müllerson. Ukraine: Victim of Geopolitics // Chinese Journal of International Law. — Vol. 13. — No. 1 (March 2014). — PP. 133—145</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-322"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-322">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">По мнению Украины, 400 двухсторонних и 80 международных договоров.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-327"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-327">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">Условием нормализации отношений признание крымского референдума Россия назвала ещё 22 февраля<sup id="cite&#95;ref-Feb222022&#95;325-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Feb222022-325"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>318<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>, незадолго до начала боевых действий, однако тогда же это требование было отвергнуто украинскими властями как противоречащее «выбору украинского общества»<sup id="cite&#95;ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>319<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-370"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-370">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text">В канун референдума о статусе Крыма в марте 2014 года, согласно совместному телефонному опросу <a href="/wiki/%D0%92%D0%A6%D0%98%D0%9E%D0%9C" class="mw-redirect" title="ВЦИОМ">ВЦИОМ</a> и <a href="/wiki/%D0%A4%D0%9E%D0%9C" class="mw-redirect" title="ФОМ">ФОМ</a> в 83 регионах РФ, 91&#160;% россиян одобряли присоединение Крыма к России, 5&#160;% были против, остальные не смогли определиться<sup id="cite&#95;ref-368" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-368"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>360<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite&#95;ref-369" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-369"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>361<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>. Этот опрос, ставший «социологическим обоснованием (подкреплением) важнейшего политического решения» (на него прямо сослался президент Путин в своём <a href="/wiki/%D0%9A%D1%80%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%87%D1%8C_%D0%92%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%B8%D1%80%D0%B0_%D0%9F%D1%83%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B0" title="Крымская речь Владимира Путина">обращении</a><sup id="cite&#95;ref-crsp&#95;365-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-crsp-365"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>357<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>), предполагал всего три варианта ответа — «Да» (поддерживаю/согласен), «нет», «затрудняюсь ответить».</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Источники"><span id=".D0.98.D1.81.D1.82.D0.BE.D1.87.D0.BD.D0.B8.D0.BA.D0.B8"></span>Источники</h3></div>
<div class="reflist columns" style="list-style-type: decimal;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;133a7d271c1a96e2-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_133a7d271c1a96e2_1-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMcDermott2015">McDermott, 2015</a>, p.&#160;9—10: «Although much of the narrative of events in Russia’s operation to restore Crimea, resulting in its formal annexation on March 18, 2014, is relatively easily established, there remain some contradictions and inherent problems in relation to the ‘start date’ for the operation. In early March 2015, President Putin stated in a Russian documentary trailer that he ordered the operation to ‘restore’ Crimea to Russia following an all-night emergency meeting in the Kremlin that began on February 22, 2014. The medal to decorate participants in the Russian operation ‘Liberation<small>[<i><a href="/wiki/Sic" title="Sic">sic</a></i>]</small> of Crimea,’ is dated ‘February 20’ to ‘March 18’ 2014; in other words, commencing two days before Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych fled Kyiv.¹³<span class="nowrap">&lt;…&gt;</span>Russian intelligence penetration, as already noted, of Ukraine’s intelligence agencies, implies possible foreknowledge of the collapse of the Yanukovych government. Ukrainian General Staff sources suggested later that they had detected ‘unusual’ Russian activity in Crimea in January 2014, but that Kyiv had ignored such warnings.¹⁷ Nonetheless, such post-factum claims are difficult to test and even if there was some type of ‘unusual’ activity’ in Crimea as early as January 2014 it does not imply foreknowledge of the collapse of the Yanukovych regime. In this context Putin most likely ordered planning to be intensified on February 20, while only giving final authorization on February 22/3, 2014.».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-CrimeanInvasion-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-CrimeanInvasion_2-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CrimeanInvasion_2-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CrimeanInvasion_2-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CrimeanInvasion_2-3"><sup><i><b>4</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jhuapl.edu/Content/documents/RussianInvasionCrimeanPeninsula.pdf">The Russian Invasion of the Crimean Peninsula 2014–2015</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;<a href="/wiki/Johns_Hopkins_University" class="mw-redirect" title="Johns Hopkins University">Johns Hopkins University</a>.&#32;Дата обращения: 24 сентября 2021.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220206000517/https://www.jhuapl.edu/Content/documents/RussianInvasionCrimeanPeninsula.pdf">Архивировано</a> 6 февраля 2022 года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;cc84814ff9cb1aad-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_cc84814ff9cb1aad_3-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKofman2017">Kofman, 2017</a>, A Chronology of events, p.&#160;12: «By March 26, the annexation was essentially complete, and Russia began returning seized military hardware to Ukraine.²¹».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-4">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>John Simpson.</i>&#32;<span lang="en"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26644082">Russia's Crimea plan detailed, secret and successful</a></span>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#32;<i><a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a></i>&#32;(19 марта 2014).&#160;— «For much of February, thousands of extra soldiers were quietly sent in to the bases which Russia was permitted by treaty to own in Crimea. Civilian "volunteers" moved in too. The plan was carried out secretly and with complete success.»&#32;Дата обращения: 30 января 2019.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220224083606/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26644082">Архивировано</a> 24 февраля 2022 года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;d3763cac2f4cc205-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_d3763cac2f4cc205_5-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKofman2017">Kofman, 2017</a>, p.&#160;75: «In Crimea, Russia achieved quick success through direct application of military power, while in Eastern Ukraine, its leadership took an entirely different approach.».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-поворотный&#95;момент-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-поворотный_момент_6-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-поворотный_момент_6-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-поворотный_момент_6-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.dw.com/ru/rossija-i-ukraina-kak-oni-okazalis-na-poroge-bolshoj-vojny/a-60223489">Россия против Украины. Как дело дошло до большой войны</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;<a href="/wiki/Deutsche_Welle" title="Deutsche Welle">Deutsche Welle</a>&#32;(24 февраля 2022).&#32;Дата обращения: 31 марта 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220608062700/https://www.dw.com/ru/rossija-i-ukraina-kak-oni-okazalis-na-poroge-bolshoj-vojny/a-60223489">Архивировано</a> 8 июня 2022 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-International&#95;Law-58"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-International_Law_58-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i><span data-interwiki-lang="et" data-interwiki-article="Lauri Mälksoo"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lauri_M%C3%A4lksoo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lauri Mälksoo (страница отсутствует)">Lauri Mälksoo</a></span><sup class="noprint" style="font-style:normal; font-weight:normal;"><a href="https://et.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauri_M%C3%A4lksoo" class="extiw" title="et:Lauri Mälksoo"><span title="Lauri Mälksoo — версия статьи «Lauri Mälksoo» на эстонском языке">[эст.]</span></a></sup>.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ejil.org/pdfs/30/1/2964.pdf">The Annexation of Crimea and Balance of Power in International Law</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/European_Journal_of_International_Law" title="European Journal of International Law">European Journal of International Law</a>, 2019.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230317215147/http://www.ejil.org/pdfs/30/1/2964.pdf">Архивировано</a> 17&#160;марта 2023&#160;года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-Маркедонов2-59"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-Маркедонов2_59-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Маркедонов2_59-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Маркедонов2_59-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Маркедонов2_59-3"><sup><i><b>4</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Sergei  Markedonov.</i>&#32;<span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.siwps.org/wp-content/uploads/Markedonov.pdf">The Challenge of Crimea for Russia’s Domestic and Foreign Policy</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>&#32;(6 июня 2016).&#32;Дата обращения: 5 апреля 2019.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220608054101/http://www.siwps.org/wp-content/uploads/Markedonov.pdf">Архивировано</a> 8 июня 2022 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-:25-60"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:25_60-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:25_60-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><span class="citation no-wikidata" data-wikidata-property-id="P1343"><i>Paul D'Anieri.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books/about/Ukraine_and_Russia.html?id=ASysEAAAQBAJ">Ukraine and Russia</a>.&#160;— Cambridge University Press, 2023-03-23.&#160;— С.&#160;241, 242.&#160;— 387&#160;с.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%B1%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F:%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B3/9781009315500" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 978-1-009-31550-0</a>.&#32;— [<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20231110154653/https://books.google.com/books/about/Ukraine_and_Russia.html?id=ASysEAAAQBAJ">Архивировано</a> 10&#160;ноября 2023&#160;года.]</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-Як&#95;це&#95;було-61"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-3"><sup><i><b>4</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-4"><sup><i><b>5</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Як_це_було_61-5"><sup><i><b>6</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="uk"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.istpravda.com.ua/columns/2023/02/23/162420/">Окупація Криму. Як це було</a></span>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на украинском языке" style="cursor:help;">(укр.)</span>.&#32;<a href="/wiki/%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%B4%D0%B0" class="mw-redirect" title="Историческая правда">Историческая правда</a>&#32;(23 февраля 2023).&#32;Дата обращения: 18 мая 2023.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230518115352/https://www.istpravda.com.ua/columns/2023/02/23/162420/">Архивировано</a> 18 мая 2023 года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-mlr-62"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-mlr_62-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-mlr_62-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-mlr_62-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><span class="citation no-wikidata" data-wikidata-property-id="P1343"><i>Tatyana Malyarenko.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.academia.edu/25462174/The_Routledge_Handbook_of_Ethnic_Conflict_2_nd_edition_edited_28_CHAPTER_A_GRADUALLY_ESCALATING_CONFLICT_Ukraine_from_the_Euromaidan_to_the_war_with_Russia">The Routledge Handbook of Ethnic Conflict: 2 nd edition; edited 28 CHAPTER &#39;A GRADUALLY ESCALATING CONFLICT: Ukraine from the Euromaidan to the war with Russia&#39;</a>.&#160;— С.&#160;352 - Russia, clearly fearful of being challenged by the new Ukrainian government over its naval base and feeling humiliated by the prospect of ‘losing’ Ukraine to the EU after all, took these threats as a welcome pretext to come to the ‘rescue’ of its co-ethnics and compatriots in Crimea. Moreover, the apparent weakness of the Ukrainian state created an opportunity for Russia to strengthen its position in the region relative to both the West and Ukraine..&#32;— [<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20191203121255/https://www.academia.edu/25462174/The_Routledge_Handbook_of_Ethnic_Conflict_2_nd_edition_edited_28_CHAPTER_A_GRADUALLY_ESCALATING_CONFLICT_Ukraine_from_the_Euromaidan_to_the_war_with_Russia">Архивировано</a> 3&#160;декабря 2019&#160;года.]</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-pawn-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-pawn_63-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pawn_63-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pawn_63-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/crimea-russias-little-pawn">Crimea: Russia’s Little Pawn</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160817161027/https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/crimea-russias-little-pawn">Архивная копия</a> от 17 августа 2016 на <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>&#160;— «Ukraine and its Western backers still hotly contest the annexation, but it went virtually unchallenged by the Ukrainian military. Ukrainian troops who were on the peninsula before the annexation either defected to the Russian military or returned to Ukraine. And though the near-unanimous results of the referendum raised suspicions in the West, the reality is that most of Crimea’s inhabitants wanted to become part of Russia. Crimea has traditionally been the most pro-Russian part of Ukraine, and many on the peninsula viewed Yanukovich’s ouster as a coup orchestrated and supported by Western powers»</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-64">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><cite class="citation news cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26367786">Why Crimea is so dangerous</a>. <i>BBC News</i>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>. 11 марта 2014. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180531064619/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26367786">Архивировано</a> 31 мая 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Дата обращения: 27 мая 2018</span>. <q>The region voted heavily for Viktor Yanukovych in the 2010 presidential election, and many people there believe he is the victim of a coup - prompting separatists in Crimea's parliament to vote for joining the Russian Federation and a referendum on secession.</q>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Why+Crimea+is+so+dangerous&amp;rft.date=2014-03-11&amp;rft&#95;id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.com%2Fnews%2Fworld-europe-26367786&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fru.wikipedia.org%3A%D0%90%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F+%D0%9A%D1%80%D1%8B%D0%BC%D0%B0+%D0%A0%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B9+%D0%A4%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B5%D0%B9" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-65">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><cite id="CITEREFOliphant2014" class="citation news cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source">Oliphant, Roland (27 февраля 2014). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10666557/Keep-out-of-Ukraine-America-tells-Russia.html">Keep out of Ukraine, America tells Russia</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a></i>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180619042544/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10666557/Keep-out-of-Ukraine-America-tells-Russia.html">Архивировано</a> 19 июня 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Дата обращения: 13 июня 2018</span>. <q>Tensions in the Russian-majority Crimea soared after ethnic Russians established checkpoints on roads and raised vigilante defence groups in response to what many there see as an illegitimate coup by far-Right forces in Kiev.</q>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Guardian&amp;rft.atitle=Keep+out+of+Ukraine%2C+America+tells+Russia&amp;rft.date=2014-02-27&amp;rft.aulast=Oliphant&amp;rft.aufirst=Roland&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.telegraph.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fworldnews%2Feurope%2Fukraine%2F10666557%2FKeep-out-of-Ukraine-America-tells-Russia.html&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fru.wikipedia.org%3A%D0%90%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F+%D0%9A%D1%80%D1%8B%D0%BC%D0%B0+%D0%A0%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B9+%D0%A4%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B5%D0%B9" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;9bc4cc6f862ae193-67"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-_9bc4cc6f862ae193_67-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-_9bc4cc6f862ae193_67-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMcDermott2015">McDermott2015</a>, p.&#160;14: «Intelligence gathered in Kyiv and the use of Russian intelligence in Crimea not only afforded Moscow a clearer insight into the capacity of the Ukrainian state to respond, but was also an important element locally in preparing the potential battleield, with FSB, SVR and GRU involved in stirring up local protests, hiding among the population and conducting reconnaissance and subversive operations.».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-СНБО-28-02-14-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-СНБО-28-02-14_68-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-СНБО-28-02-14_68-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.rnbo.gov.ua/files/2016/stenogr.pdf">Стенограмма заседания Совета национальной безопасности и обороны Украины от 28 февраля 2014&#160;года («О неотложных мерах по обеспечению национальной безопасности, суверенитета и территориальной целостности Украины»)</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181222213851/http://www.rnbo.gov.ua/files/2016/stenogr.pdf">Архивная копия</a> от 22 декабря 2018 на <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на украинском языке" style="cursor:help;">(укр.)</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;034e87b8cedd1a3f-69"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_034e87b8cedd1a3f_69-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFБДИПЧ-2014">БДИПЧ-2014</a>, с.&#160;115—116: «С наступлением политического кризиса в Украине многоэтничное общество Крыма стремительно поляризовалось. Это стало очевидно 26-27 февраля 2014 года, когда выступающие за единство Украины крымские татары противостояли пророссийским демонстрантам в центре г. Симферополя. В ходе противостояния возникла давка, в которой погибло два человека. Опасность межэтнического конфликта обострилась в период, предшествовавший так называемому „референдуму о статусе Крыма“ 16 марта 2014 г., который крымские татары массово бойкотировали. Большинство собеседников ВКНМ заявили, что хотя спорное решение об отмене Закона „О языке“ (невзирая на наложение вето со стороны исполняющего обязанности Президента), а также решения о подготовке закона о люстрации, не стали решающими факторами, спровоцировавшими волнения в Крыму, они способствовали мобилизации значительного количества этнических русских против новых органов власти в Киеве. Действительные страхи перед политикой реваншизма в отношении русскоязычного меньшинства подпитывались слухами и однобокими сообщениями в СМИ, а также беспочвенными радикальными заявлениями ряда политиков».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-автоссылка3-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-автоссылка3_70-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-автоссылка3_70-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>John Biersack, Shannon O’Lear.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080/15387216.2014.985241">The geopolitics of Russia's annexation of Crimea: narratives, identity, silences, and energy</a>&#160;// Eurasian Geography and Economics.&#160;— 2014-05-04.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Т. 55</span>, <span class="nowrap">вып. 3</span>.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">С. 247–269</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%9C%D0%B5%D0%B6%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B9%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%80" class="mw-redirect" title="Международный стандартный серийный номер">ISSN</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/search?fq=x0:jrnl&amp;q=n2:1538-7216">1538-7216</a>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/Doi" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://dx.doi.org/10.1080%2F15387216.2014.985241">10.1080/15387216.2014.985241</a>.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-71">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.unian.net/politics/896933-medjlis-vyistupil-s-obrascheniem-podderjivayuschim-ukrainu-i-osujdayuschim-agressiyu-rf.html">Меджлис выступил с обращением, поддерживающим Украину и осуждающим агрессию РФ. УНИАН, 15.03.2014</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#160;— «...
- не признает крымский референдум 16 марта 2014 года, проводимый с целью изменить территориальную принадлежность Крыма, легитимным и соответствующим международном праву и Конституции Украины;».&#32;Дата обращения: 27 июня 2015.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180709035258/https://www.unian.net/politics/896933-medjlis-vyistupil-s-obrascheniem-podderjivayuschim-ukrainu-i-osujdayuschim-agressiyu-rf.html">Архивировано</a> 9 июля 2018 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;03a5c2a7d33efe3b-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-_03a5c2a7d33efe3b_73-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-_03a5c2a7d33efe3b_73-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKofman2017">Kofman, 2017</a>, A Chronology of Events, pp.&#160;6—7: «Russian operations in Crimea effectively began on February 22 and 23, as battalions of Spetsnaz (elite infantry) units and Vozdushno-Desantnye Voyska (Airborne Forces or VDV) left their bases, while others were airlifted close to the strait separating Russia from Crimea. Figure 2.1 provides an overview of Russian operations in Crimea through March 9».</span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-:5-91"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:5_91-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:5_91-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/russian/russia/2015/03/150315_putin_crimea_documentary">Путин угрожал Западу ядерным оружием из-за Крыма</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;Дата обращения: 27 сентября 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220927151202/https://www.bbc.com/russian/russia/2015/03/150315_putin_crimea_documentary">Архивировано</a> 27 сентября 2022 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-:8-92"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:8_92-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:8_92-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.vedomosti.ru/politics/news/2015/03/16/putin-gotov-bil-privesti-v-boegotovnost-yadernoe-oruzhie-iz-za-krima">Путин готов был привести в боеготовность ядерное оружие из-за Крыма</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;Дата обращения: 27 сентября 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220927151204/https://www.vedomosti.ru/politics/news/2015/03/16/putin-gotov-bil-privesti-v-boegotovnost-yadernoe-oruzhie-iz-za-krima">Архивировано</a> 27 сентября 2022 года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-:02-93"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:02_93-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:02_93-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:02_93-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Coleman, Denise Youngblood.</i>&#32;<span lang="en"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://alabama.ebscoed.com/eds/detail?db=buh&amp;an=157232172">RUSSIA COUNTRY REVIEW</a></span>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#32;<i>Alabama Online Learning Repository</i>.&#160;— «Nevertheless, on March 16, 2014, voters went to the polls in Crimea to participate in a hastily organized referendum aimed at ratifying its breakaway from Ukraine and its union with Russia. The move was largely viewed as an illegal move that contravened against international law, and as discussed above, it was guaranteed to be rejected by most countries of the world.

The referendum itself was being regarded as something of a sham as no international monitors were present to witness the event, while accredited journalists were required to pledge not to report "negative news." Meanwhile, with the region's original but minority Tartar population boycotting
the vote, the outcome was almost guaranteed to be ratification of a proposed union with Russia.»&#32;Дата обращения: 22 ноября 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20221122085235/https://alabama.ebscoed.com/eds/detail?db=buh&amp;an=157232172">Архивировано</a> 22 ноября 2022 года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-94"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-94">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Christian Marxsen.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://papers.ssrn.com/abstract=2520530">The Crimea Crisis – An International Law Perspective</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#160;— Rochester, NY: Social Science Research Network, 2014-11-07.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">No. ID 2520530</span>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20231023044630/https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=2520530">Архивировано</a> 23&#160;октября 2023&#160;года.</span></span>
</li>

Дата обращения: 10 декабря 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=%D0%92%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8&amp;rft.atitle=%D0%94%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%80%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9+%D1%8D%D1%84%D1%84%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%82+%D0%9A%D1%80%D1%8B%D0%BC%D0%B0&amp;rft.date=2017-03-17&amp;rft.au=%D0%92%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B2&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vedomosti.ru%2Fopinion%2Farticles%2F2017%2F03%2F17%2F681693-dolgosrochnii-effekt&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fru.wikipedia.org%3A%D0%90%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F+%D0%9A%D1%80%D1%8B%D0%BC%D0%B0+%D0%A0%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B9+%D0%A4%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B5%D0%B9" class="Z3988"></span> <span class="cs1-hidden-error citation-comment"><code class="cs1-code">{{<a href="/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:Cite_news" title="Шаблон:Cite news">cite news</a>}}</code>: </span><span class="cs1-hidden-error citation-comment">Указан более чем один параметр <code class="cs1-code">&#124;author=</code> and <code class="cs1-code">&#124;last=</code> (<a href="/wiki/%D0%92%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%BF%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%8F:%D0%9E%D1%88%D0%B8%D0%B1%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D1%88%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2_CS1/2#redundant_parameters" title="Википедия:Ошибки шаблонов CS1/2">справка</a>)</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-138"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-138">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Aleksandar Matovski.</i>&#32;<span lang="en"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/01/16/why-would-putin-invade-ukraine/">Why would Putin invade Ukraine?</a></span>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#32;<i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i>&#32;(16 января 2022).&#160;— And when “strongman fatigue” turned Russians against his regime in 2011 and 2012, Putinism was resuscitated by another conflict. As the chart below shows, by 2013, more Russians wanted Putin to leave office than stay for another term. But Putin’s annexation of Crimea completely reversed this trend. With Putin appearing as Russia’s indispensable protector, the conflict in Ukraine paved his way to another easy reelection in 2018.&#32;Дата обращения: 16 апреля 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220116204418/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/01/16/why-would-putin-invade-ukraine/">Архивировано</a> 16 января 2022 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-139"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-139">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="https://www.vox.com/2014/9/3/18088560/ukraine-everything-you-need-to-know">[1]</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220122003807/https://www.vox.com/2014/9/3/18088560/ukraine-everything-you-need-to-know">Архивная копия</a> от 22 января 2022 на <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> In February, anti-government protests toppled the government and ran Yanukovych out of the country. Russia, trying to salvage its lost influence in Ukraine, invaded and annexed Crimea the next month.</span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-:26-181"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:26_181-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:26_181-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><span class="citation no-wikidata" data-wikidata-property-id="P1343"><i>Maria Popova, Oxana Shevel.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=MmTiEAAAQBAJ&amp;newbks=0&amp;printsec=frontcover&amp;pg=PT123&amp;dq=Aksyonov+Mohyliov+crimea&amp;hl=en">Russia and Ukraine: Entangled Histories, Diverging States</a>.&#160;— John Wiley &amp; Sons, 2023-11-08.&#160;— 209&#160;с.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%B1%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F:%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B3/9781509557387" class="internal 26&#160;января 2024&#160;года.]</span><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r136229245">.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0.5em 0}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote{position:relative;margin:0;padding:0 42px;border:none;background:transparent;line-height:1.6em;font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote::before,.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote::after{content:"";position:absolute;background-size:1.6em calc(1.6em/1.1);background-repeat:no-repeat;background-position:50%50%;width:calc(1.6em/0.75);height:1.6em}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote::before{background-image:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/4d/Left_pointing_double_angle_quotation_mark_sh1.svg");top:0;left:0}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote::after{background-image:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/de/Right_pointing_double_angle_quotation_mark_sh1.svg");bottom:0;right:0}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата blockquote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата cite{display:block;text-align:right;font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата p:first-child{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата .ts-oq-header.ts-oq-header{padding-left:0;background:transparent}.mw-parser-output .ts-Цитата .ts-oq .ts-oq-content{padding:0}</style><div class="ts-Цитата"><blockquote><p>Within barely a week of Yanukovich's flight from country and his replacement with an interim president in Kyiv, a covert Russian special operation replaced the local government in Crimea with Russian proxies and directed them to prepare the region for Russian annexation.</p></blockquote></div></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-182"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-182">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/ukraines-unnamed-war/ukraines-unnamed-war/4C1C0FB94FD3F899272BB1C5599D6916">Ukraine’s Unnamed War</a>&#160;// Ukraine's Unnamed War: Before the Russian Invasion of 2022&#32; / Dominique Arel, Jesse Driscoll.&#160;— Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2023.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">С. 119</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%B1%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F:%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B3/9781316511497" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 978-1-316-51149-7</a>.</span>&#160;— «Did Crimea break with Kyiv on its own, and then ask Russia for help? Not exactly. After a mass demonstration prevented the Crimean parliament from enacting such a scenario, Russian special forces arrived the following morning. Meeting no resistance, they secured parliament, and installed a pro-Russia government. Within thirty-six hours, the new government issued the call for help.»</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-183"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-183">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jhuapl.edu/Content/documents/RussianInvasionCrimeanPeninsula.pdf">The Russian Invasion of the Crimean Peninsula 2014–2015</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;<i>Johns Hopkins University</i>.&#32;Дата обращения: 13 мая 2022.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220206000517/https://www.jhuapl.edu/Content/documents/RussianInvasionCrimeanPeninsula.pdf">Архивировано</a> 6 февраля 2022 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-223"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-223">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><cite id="CITEREFFinley2014" class="citation news cs1">Finley, JC (27 февраля 2014). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2014/02/27/Unrest-in-Crimea-leaves-2-dead-government-buildings-seized/6371393516263/">Unrest in Crimea leaves 2 dead; government buildings seized</a>. <li id="cite&#95;note-246"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-246">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2022/10/14/russias-attempt-to-annex-kherson-zaporizhzhia-donetsk-and-luhansk-has-undermined-its-claim-on-crimea/">Russia’s attempt to annex Kherson, Zaporizhzhia, Donetsk, and Luhansk has undermined its claim on Crimea</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;<i>EUROPP</i>&#32;(14 октября 2022).&#32;Дата обращения: 14 марта 2023.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230322203937/https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2022/10/14/russias-attempt-to-annex-kherson-zaporizhzhia-donetsk-and-luhansk-has-undermined-its-claim-on-crimea/">Архивировано</a> 22 марта 2023 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;6b86f73f1219fe2b-247"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_6b86f73f1219fe2b_247-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKofman2017">Kofman, 2017</a>, p.&#160;xii.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;3185e4d24557a59f-248"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_3185e4d24557a59f_248-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFБДИПЧ-2014">БДИПЧ-2014</a>, с.&#160;115—116.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-249"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-249">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><span class="citation no-wikidata" data-wikidata-property-id="P1343"><i>Taras Kuzio.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books/about/Putin_s_War_Against_Ukraine.html?id=frfXAQAACAAJ">Putin's War Against Ukraine: Revolution, Nationalism, and Crime</a>.&#160;— CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform, 2017.&#160;— С.&#160;44 - Language is by far the biggest myth in the crisis and yet it played little role in Russia’s annexation of the Crimea and is not playing an important role in the Donbas conflict. A November-December 2016 survey asked respondents to chose what were the three most important national issues they believed Ukraine was facing. Only one percent believed gaining official status for the Russian language was important coming second from the bottom of seventeen issues.[24] International human rights organisations reported there was no threat to Russian speakers in the Crimea in spring 2014. Ukrainian opinion polls provide added confirmation that language is not an important issue in eastern Ukraine. Minister of Information Policy Yuriy Stets said ‘In Ukraine there will not be xenophobia towards the Russian language and literature.’[25] Two thirds of Ukrainian troops in the ATO are Russian speakers and nationalist battalions Pravyy Sektor (Right Sector) and Azov include Russian language speakers. Ukraine’s largely Russian-language speaking Jewish community has provided resources for Ukrainian forces fighting Russian and separatist proxies. The preponderance of Russian speakers among Ukrainian troops and nationalist battalions undercuts the myth of the Donbas conflict being an outgrowth of a ‘nationalist’ state unwilling to be inclusive enough to accommodate its Russian speakers..&#160;— 474&#160;с.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%B1%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F:%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B3/9781543285864" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 978-1-5432-8586-4</a>.&#32;— [<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20231031101447/https://books.google.com/books/about/Putin_s_War_Against_Ukraine.html?id=frfXAQAACAAJ">Архивировано</a> 31&#160;октября 2023&#160;года.]</span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite&#95;note-к&#95;13&#95;годам-262"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-к_13_годам_262-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-к_13_годам_262-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/news-russian-46985187">Януковича приговорили к 13 годам заключения</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;<a href="/wiki/%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B1%D0%B0_%D0%91%D0%B8-%D0%B1%D0%B8-%D1%81%D0%B8" title="Украинская служба Би-би-си">Украинская служба Би-би-си</a>&#32;(24 января 2019).&#32;Дата обращения: 27 мая 2023.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230527082142/https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/news-russian-46985187">Архивировано</a> 27 мая 2023 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-263"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-263">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation" id="CITEREFBorgen2015"><i>Borgen, Christopher J.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://digital-commons.usnwc.edu/ils/vol91/iss1/7/">Law, Rhetoric, Strategy:  Russia and Self-Determination Before and After Crimea</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>&#160;// International Law Studies.&#160;— 2015.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Vol. 91</span>, <span class="nowrap">iss. 1</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%9C%D0%B5%D0%B6%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B9%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%80" class="mw-redirect" title="Международный стандартный серийный номер">ISSN</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/search?fq=x0:jrnl&amp;q=n2:2375-2831">2375-2831</a>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220221230535/https://digital-commons.usnwc.edu/ils/vol91/iss1/7/">Архивировано</a> 21&#160;февраля 2022&#160;года.</span>&#160;— «The recognition of Crimea by Russia was the legal fig leaf which allowed Russia to say that it did not annex Crimea from Ukraine, rather the Republic of Crimea exercised its sovereign powers in seeking a merge with Russia.»</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-265"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-265">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Sergey Markedonov.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080/23761199.2015.1086565">De facto statehood in Eurasia: a political and security phenomenon</a>&#160;// Caucasus Survey.&#160;— 2015-09-02.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Т. 3</span>, <span class="nowrap">вып. 3</span>.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">С. 195—206</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%9C%D0%B5%D0%B6%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B9%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%80" class="mw-redirect" title="Международный стандартный серийный номер">ISSN</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/search?fq=x0:jrnl&amp;q=n2:2376-1199">2376-1199</a>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/Doi" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://dx.doi.org/10.1080%2F23761199.2015.1086565">10.1080/23761199.2015.1086565</a>.</span>&#160;— «In March 2014 Moscow unilaterally changed the status of the Crimean peninsula (previously
an autonomous region of Ukraine), after the Republic of Crimea had existed as an unrecognized entity for less than a month»</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-:2-266"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-:2_266-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:2_266-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:2_266-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r150646110" /><span class="citation no-wikidata" data-wikidata-property-id="P1343"><i>Vebi Kosumi.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190329222914/https://books.google.ru/books?id=hs5QDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT31#v=onepage&amp;q&amp;f=false">Can Crimea Claim Secession and Accession to Russian Federation in Light of Kosovo’S Independence?</a>.&#160;— AuthorHouse, 2018-02-27.&#160;— 96&#160;с.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%B1%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F:%D0%98%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B8_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B3/9781546288886" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 9781546288886</a>.&#32;— [Архивировано из <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.ru/books?id=hs5QDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT31">оригинала</a> 29&#160;марта 2019&#160;года.]</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-267"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-267">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Theodore Christakis.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://papers.ssrn.com/abstract=2531321">Self-Determination, Territorial Integrity and Fait Accompli in the Case of Crimea</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>.&#160;— Rochester, NY: Social Science Research Network, 2014-11-03.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">No. ID 2531321</span>.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-268"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-268">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Adam Šućur.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&amp;id_clanak_jezik=209344">Observing the Question of Secession in the Wake of Recent Events in Kosovo, Abkhazia, South Ossetia and Crimea</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>&#160;// Zagrebačka pravna revija.&#160;— 2014.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Vol. 3</span>, <span class="nowrap">iss. 3</span>.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">P. 275—301</span>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190330093701/https://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&amp;id_clanak_jezik=209344">Архивировано</a> 30&#160;марта 2019&#160;года.</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;55d8de3b4d7dc8c5-269"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-_55d8de3b4d7dc8c5_269-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-_55d8de3b4d7dc8c5_269-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFBorgen2015">Borgen, 2015</a>, p.&#160;251: «At the time that Crimea declared independence, its territory was completely contested—this was not an issue of where the border between Crimea and Ukraine should be, but a dispute over the whole of Crimea. Moreover, it was very much in doubt whether Crimea had a functional government or the capacity to enter into international relations: Crimea as a supposedly independent entity would not exist but for Russian military intervention. And the control of Crimean territory seemed to be more under the command of the Russian President than the Crimean authorities.».</span>
</li>

<li id="cite&#95;note-282"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-282">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ostinstitut.de/documents/Vlkerrechtswidrigkeit_der_Unabhngigkeitserklrung_und_des_Referendums_der_Krim.pdf">Prof. Dr. Otto Luchterhandt. Die Völkerrechtswidrigkeit der Unabhängigkeitserklärung und des Referendums der Krim</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220124133240/http://www.ostinstitut.de/documents/Vlkerrechtswidrigkeit_der_Unabhngigkeitserklrung_und_des_Referendums_der_Krim.pdf">Архивная копия</a> от 24 января 2022 на <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> // Wissenschaftliche Beiträge des Ostinstituts Wismar.&#160;— 2014.&#160;— Heft 2.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-283"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-283">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Trevor McDougal.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://digitalcommons.law.byu.edu/lawreview/vol2015/iss6/15">A New Imperialism? Evaluating Russia’s Acquisition of Crimea in the Context of National and International Law</a>&#160;// BYU Law Review.&#160;— 2015-12-31.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Т. 2015</span>, <span class="nowrap">вып. 6</span>.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">С. 1847—1888</span>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190330205303/https://digitalcommons.law.byu.edu/lawreview/vol2015/iss6/15/">Архивировано</a> 30&#160;марта 2019&#160;года.</span>&#160;— «Putin has admitted that he „ordered special forces, marines and paratroopers to be deployed ‘under the guise of reinforcing our military facilities in Crimea.’“ This seems to indicate that the impetus for annexation was not driven by Crimea, but rather by Russia.&lt;…&gt;Finally, if the allegations made by Novaya Gazeta are true regarding Russia’s intentions to enter Crimea and agitate the population into seeking to join the Russian Federation, it is possible to consider Russia’s actions to be in violation of the domestic law as the population of Crimea did not act of its own free will and did not initiate the negotiations regarding joining Russia, which is another requirement of Russia’s constitutional law».</span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-284"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-284">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Томсинов В. А.</i>&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://tomsinov.com/russia_contemp/vossoedinenie_kryma_s_rossiei.pdf">Международное право с точки зрения воссоединения Крыма с Россией</a>&#160;// Законодательство.&#160;— 2014.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">№ 7</span>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181123160808/http://tomsinov.com/russia_contemp/vossoedinenie_kryma_s_rossiei.pdf">Архивировано</a> 23&#160;ноября 2018&#160;года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-285"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-285">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i><a href="/wiki/%D0%A2%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2,_%D0%92%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%B8%D1%80_%D0%90%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%B5%D0%B5%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%87" title="Томсинов, Владимир Алексеевич">Томсинов В. <li id="cite&#95;note-дисф-306"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-дисф_306-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-дисф_306-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-дисф_306-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">С. Russia’s annexation of Crimea may not have widespread legitimacy but at this point in time it has it where it counts, within Russia and within Crimea».</span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-crsp-365"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-crsp_365-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-crsp_365-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.kremlin.ru/news/20603">Обращение Президента Российской Федерации</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#32;Дата обращения: 18 марта 2014.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140321160157/http://www.kremlin.ru/news/20603">Архивировано</a> 21 марта 2014 года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-366"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-366">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://undocs.org/ru/S/PV.7384">Совет Безопасности. Семидесятый год. 7384-е заседание. Вторник, 17 февраля 2015 года, 15 ч. 00 м. Нью-Йорк</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>.&#160;— «Двое коллег упомянули Крым. На все эти заявления мы можем ответить даже не одним словом, а одной цифрой. Эта цифра — 93. Недавно немецкое агентство, которое занимается изучением общественного мнения, провело опрос жителей Крыма и пришло к выводу, что 93 процента жителей Крыма поддерживает воссоединение с Россией. Если быть точным — 82 процента сказали «безоговорочно», 11 процентов сказали «скорее поддерживаем», 4 процента было против. Это немного даже больше, чем та цифра, которую мы имели на референдуме в пользу воссоединения с Россией.»&#32;Дата обращения: 5 апреля 2019.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190324093730/https://undocs.org/ru/S/PV.7384">Архивировано</a> 24 марта 2019 года.</span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite&#95;note-374"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-374">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><i>Austin Charron.</i>&#32;Whose is Crimea?: Contested Sovereignty and Regional Identity&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>&#160;// Region: Regional Studies of Russia, Eastern Europe, and Central Asia.&#160;— Slavica Publishers, 2016.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">Vol. 5</span>, <span class="nowrap">no. 2</span>.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">P. 239</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/Doi" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://dx.doi.org/10.1353%2Freg.2016.0017">10.1353/reg.2016.0017</a>.</span>&#160;— «However, several authors have cautioned that surveys conducted in occupied Crimea concerning identities and support for the annexation are unreliable, as an oppressive political environment and harsh punitive repercussions for refuting Russian sovereignty over the region effectively silence those in opposition».</span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-&#95;e31744b75640faf6-376"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="#cite_ref-_e31744b75640faf6_376-0">↑</a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFToal2019">Toal, 2019</a>, p.&#160;11: «Critics of Russia’s actions often point to public opinion polls before March 2014 as indicating that majority sentiment in Crimea was not secessionist. Sentiment on this score, however, was in flux. Majority sentiment toward the Euromaidan protests in Crimea was overwhelmingly negative and separatist feelings rose as the Euromaidan protests endured and radicalized».</span>

Electoral Consequences of Occupation</a>&#160;<span class="ref-info" title="на английском языке" style="cursor:help;">(англ.)</span>&#160;// East European Politics and Societies.&#160;— 2018-08-09.&#160;— <span class="nowrap">P. 0888325418791020</span>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/%D0%9C%D0%B5%D0%B6%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B9%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%80" class="mw-redirect" title="Международный стандартный серийный номер">ISSN</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/search?fq=x0:jrnl&amp;q=n2:0888-3254">0888-3254</a>.&#160;— <a href="/wiki/Doi" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://dx.doi.org/10.1177%2F0888325418791020">10.1177/0888325418791020</a>.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190330161549/https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0888325418791020">Архивировано</a> 30&#160;марта 2019&#160;года.</span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-Женева&#95;плюс-405"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">↑ <a href="#cite_ref-Женева_плюс_405-0"><sup><i><b>1</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Женева_плюс_405-1"><sup><i><b>2</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Женева_плюс_405-2"><sup><i><b>3</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Женева_плюс_405-3"><sup><i><b>4</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Женева_плюс_405-4"><sup><i><b>5</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation"><span lang="und"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/ukraine_in_russian/2016/01/160126_ru_s_international_procedures_return_crimea">Переговоры по Крыму: "Женева плюс", Россия - минус?</a></span><span class="hidden-ref" style="display:none;">&#160;</span>&#32;<a href="/wiki/%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B1%D0%B0_%D0%91%D0%B8-%D0%B1%D0%B8-%D1%81%D0%B8" title="Украинская служба Би-би-си">Украинская служба Би-би-си</a>&#32;(26 января 2016).&#32;Дата обращения: 18 мая 2023.&#32;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230518195630/https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/ukraine_in_russian/2016/01/160126_ru_s_international_procedures_return_crimea">Архивировано</a> 18 мая 2023 года.</span></span>

<li>Пытки и убийства военнопленных
